timeline.bodyText:
usually if you have a proxy what is the common thing is that everything is affecting by the environment and not really at design time.
You need to ajust this to a system property and read from it. Also would be good if you can set/override the properties like which proxy to use
you have examples here how to do this
https://github.com/kiegroup/droolsjbpm-integration/blob/master/kie-server-parent/kie-server-api/src/main/java/org/kie/server/api/KieServerConstants.java#L39
timeline.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText:
The decission to use system properties or not is not base on the value of this private variable. The decision to use system properties or not is based on the value of the parameter passed to the constructor.
This private constant is there to make easier maintance in case we decide to use system properties by default in the future. Now, for backward compatibility, the default value is false. If in future we decide to use them by default, we just need to change the constant (so this constant was introduce just becasue we have many constructor, if this class was built from scracth, we should use a builder pattern)
If we were going to control this functionality through system properties, changes in the constructor are not needed, but that was not the proposal of the JIRA, not consistent with the current structure of the code
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText: Rather than following the proposal of the JIRA, since the decission to use or not system properties should be taken as execution time, not desing time, it does not make sense to change current constructor, but provide a new system property org.kie.workspace.rest.useSystemProperties (default value false) which will determine if useSystemProperties is invoked or not when creating the http connection
replies.author: fjtirado

timeline.message:
[JBPM-9138] - RESTWorkItemHandler doesn't support proxy

Adding new constructors to RestWorkItemHandler.

Creating new constructor with additional useSystemProperties parameter,
which allow creating connection using system properties.

[JBPM-9138] - RESTWorkItemHandler doesn't support proxy

Adding new system property "org.kie.workitem.rest.useSystemProperties"
to enable useSystemProperties when creating http connection

timeline.bodyText: This is not testing anything. Just covering the line you added. remove this.
timeline.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText:
This is added for coverage and for testing that, if property is enabled and there is not any system property added, this method behaves as before.
So, I think is a very productive addition. I vote for keeping it
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText:
No it is not.

You are modifying the behaviour of the test and make it dependent of the environment (so it is out of control)
You are not testing properly if the new property is using the system properties or not. e.g. one example would be to set a wrong address default adress (unreachable) and a proxy address setting in the system properties. then see if the system is taking or not what you are doing running a get operation against the proxied server.
This is not a proper test. Please remove and add a proper test.
replies.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText: Ok, I will remove and define a specific case.
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText: Hi, you need to try to test this as well. otherwise looks good.
replies.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText: Additional test case using http.proxy system property has been added.
replies.author: fjtirado
